latestAction.text: By unanimous consent, the Volkmer amendment was withdrawn.
On agreeing to the Volkmer amendments (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.
On agreeing to the Volkmer amendment (A035) Agreed to by recorded vote: 284 - 118 (Roll no. 445).
By unanimous consent, the Volkmer amendment was withdrawn.
On agreeing to the Volkmer amendment (A014) Failed by recorded vote: 148 - 275 (Roll no. 490).
On agreeing to the Volkmer amendment (A016) Failed by recorded vote: 168 - 253 (Roll no. 172).
By unanimous consent, the Volkmer amendment was withdrawn.

Mr. Hoke raised a point of order against the Volkmer amendment (A018). Mr. Hoke stated that the provisions of the Volkmer substitute exceed the scope of the bill and in that form, cause the amendment to be non-germane. The Chair sustained the point of order.
By unanimous consent, the Volkmer amendment was withdrawn.
On agreeing to the Volkmer amendment (A004) Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 198, 3 Present (Roll no. 101).
By unanimous consent, the Volkmer amendment was withdrawn.
On agreeing to the Volkmer amendment (A018) Failed by recorded vote: 114 - 312 (Roll no. 60).
